thread.title: Tinder's new 'super like' feature could help lovelorn men - but you can swipe up ONCE per day
thread.title_full: Tinder's new 'super like' feature could help lovelorn men - but you can swipe up ONCE per day

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Tinder's new 'super like' feature could help lovelorn men - but you can swipe up ONCE per day
text:
Get daily news by email Invalid e-mail Thanks for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Tinder Tinder Super-Like 
Serial Tinder users might feel the odds are stacked against them when it comes to attracting that special someone. 
But a new feature from the selfie-styled dating app lets you swipe upwards or "star" a potential match to show them you're particularly taken with them. 
You can't just play a numbers game either - Tinder will only let you "super like" one person per day. 
Tinder's Super Like feature shows you REALLY like someone 
Someone who receives a super like will see that they have been deemed extra attractive by a potential partner. 
They will receive a bright blue star icon to show they've been picked. Tinder Tinder Super-Like 
"Because they’re so limited in number, a super like, or a “swipe up,” sends a more powerful signal, conveying an especially high level of interest," said Sean Rad, CEO of Tinder. Tinder Tinder Super-Like 
"People like to know that someone finds them special and we think this will lead to even better matches," Rad said. 
Tinder was launched in 2012 and has become one of the most popular - and infamous - dating apps on the market. 
The Super Like feature rolled out in Australia this week and will launch in other countries, including the UK, later this year. Poll loading …
